#Text=Burn MP3 to CD
#Text=Burning MP3 files to CD allows you to listen to your favorite tunes in CD players , which is convenient for those who lack digital media players and MP3 players .
#Text=MP3 files can be burned to CD in most popular music player applications , including iTunes , Windows Media Player , RealPlayer , and Winamp .
#Text=Steps
#Text=iTunes
#Text=Launch iTunes and click on “ File . ”
#Text=Click on “ New ” and select “ Playlist . ”
#Text=Type a name for the playlist , then drag and drop songs from your iTunes library into the playlist window on the right .
#Text=You must have a playlist created before you can burn songs to CD .
#Text=Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer .
#Text=Select your playlist and click on “ File . ”
#Text=Select “ Burn Playlist to Disc , ” then select either “ Audio CD ” or “ MP3 CD ” as the disc format , based on your preference .
#Text=Click on “ Burn . ”
#Text=The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and iTunes will notify you when burning is complete .
#Text=If your playlist is too large to fit on disc , iTunes will prompt you to insert another disc to finish the burning process .
#Text=Windows Media Player
#Text=Launch Windows Media Player and click on the “ Burn ” tab .
#Text=Drag and drop songs and playlists into the burn list on the right .
#Text=The songs must be added to the burn list in the order in which you want them listed on the CD .
#Text=Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer .
#Text=Click on the burn tab at the top right corner .
#Text=The icon resembles a piece of paper with a green checkmark .
#Text=Select “ Audio CD , ” then click on “ Start Burn . ”
#Text=The process will take up to several minutes , and Windows Media Player will eject the CD when burning is complete .
#Text=RealPlayer
#Text=Launch RealPlayer and click on the “ Burn ” tab .
#Text=Select “ Audio CD Burner , ” then insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer .
#Text=Click on “ Burn ” at the top of RealPlayer .
#Text=Click on “ Select CD Type ” under Tasks in the right sidebar .
#Text=Select “ Audio CD ” or “ MP3 CD , ” then click on “ OK . ”
#Text=Click on “ Add Tracks from my Library , ” then select “ All Music . ”
#Text=Drag and drop tracks from the left into the burn list on the right .
#Text=RealPlayer will keep you updated as to how much space is remaining on the disc as you move tracks to the burn list .
#Text=Click on “ Burn Your CD . ”
#Text=The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and notify you when the CD has been burned successfully .
#Text=Winamp
#Text=Launch Winamp and insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer .
#Text=Click on “ View ” and select “ Media Library . ”
#Text=Select “ Blank Disk ” from the list under Media Library , then click on “ Add ” at the bottom of the Winamp window .
#Text=Select the playlist you want burned , or click on “ Files ” or “ Folders ” to search for music .
#Text=Select the tracks you want burned to CD , then click on “ OK . ”
#Text=Click on “ Burn ” at the bottom of Winamp , then select “ Enable Burn-proof mode . ”
#Text=Click on “ Burn ” in the Burn dialog box .
#Text=The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and Winamp will notify you when the CD has been burned successfully .
#Text=Tips
#Text=When selecting a disc format , opt for “ MP3 CD ” if you want hundreds of songs burned to CD versus an average of 20 songs to CD .
#Text=MP3 files can be compressed more efficiently than other file types , which allows for hundreds of audio tracks to be burned to a single disc .
#Text=Quick Summary
